B2 only by a small amount: She narrowly missed winning the race.
in a limited way: a narrowly interpreted law
formal carefully or in a way that shows doubt: The officer looked at him narrowly through half-closed eyes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe proposal to change the rules was narrowly defeated by 201 votes to 196.He narrowly escaped a fine.The plane narrowly avoided disaster when one of the engines cut out on take-off.The nationalists were narrowly beaten in the local election.
